intro: Muscari botryoides lusus lacteiflorum, commonly known as the milk-flowered grape hyacinth, is a bulbous perennial plant native to southern Europe. It produces dense clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pale blue to white in color. The plant thrives in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for rock gardens or borders. Its foliage consists of grass-like leaves that emerge in early spring. The flowers bloom in late spring, adding a delicate and fragrant touch to the landscape.
